signature: TransformedSortedMap<K, V> transformingSortedMap(SortedMap<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)

enhanced_by.method_name: transformedMap(Map<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)
enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require a map and transformers for key and value transformations, making them suitable for similar test setup.
The transformMap method is used to transform the contents of a map, similar to how transformingSortedMap initializes transformations.
The put method in TransformedMap handles key and value transformations, similar to the transformations done in transformingSortedMap.
The transformKey method is used to transform keys, which is similar to the key transformation done in transformingSortedMap.
The transformValue method is used to transform values, which is similar to the value transformation done in transformingSortedMap.
